key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA remains higher in about 80% of itineraries, with OTA-lower instances rising from 0.5% to 2% month to month.
MSE fares exceed the website in roughly 68% of cases, with a 17% Not Found rate nearly double the prior month.
GDS fares remain higher on nearly 99% of itineraries, with minimal lower pricing or missing fares.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTA prices remain higher in over 80% of cases, indicating a consistent premium over the website.
Although still small, channel-lower instances tripled from around 0.5% to 2% compared to last month.
Website offers are missing on the OTA about 12–14% of the time, with modest week-to-week shifts.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Hovers at about 14% presence weekly, with slight 2% growth from the previous week.
Remains low overall, peaking at nearly 7% last month but declining since.
Dominates at 80–85% of itineraries, marking a strong premium position against the airline site.
Minimal incidence under 1% last week, yet up from 0.5% to 2% since last month.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: OTA Higher maintains around 82–84%, with Not Found at roughly 15%. Lower opportunities remain under 1%.
OTA Higher stands near 88% last week and shows an 8% gain from last month. OTA Lower is minor at under 2%.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: OTA Higher exceeds 89% consistently, with negligible OTA Lower and around 10% Not Found.
OTA Higher dipped from 64% to 53% month over month, while Not Found rose from 20% to 26% last week.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: OTA Higher remains above 80%, climbing from 78% last month to 84% now. Not Found steadies near 13–14%.
OTA Higher climbs from 82% to 86% week over week, reflecting a 3% monthly increase. OTA Lower remains below 2%.

mse_highlights.line_content: In the latest week, MSE listings exceeded the website’s price in about 68% of cases, indicating a consistent premium.
Roughly 17% of itineraries were not found on MSE last week, a slight dip from 18% previously but nearly double last month’s level.
MSE matched the website’s pricing on around 6% of itineraries, reflecting minimal week-on-week change.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Remained at 17.4% last week, down from 17.98% in the prior week but nearly double the 8.53% seen a month ago.
Averaged 6.5% last week, slightly above the prior week’s 5.6% and 4.2% lower than the monthly comparison.
Prevailed in 67.5% of itineraries last week, retreating 1.2% from the previous week while up 4.2% from last month.
Appeared in 8.6% of itineraries, edging up from 7.7% a week prior but showing a near 9% decline versus last month.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: MSE priced higher on 67% of routes, with 18% not found. Lower fares occurred only 8% of the time last week.
MSE higher fares reached 69%, lower fares stood at 14%, and not found hovered around 10% last week.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 21% of itineraries were not found, 68% were priced higher, and fewer than 4% had lower MSE fares.
MSE was higher in 67% of cases, not found in only 7%, and lower fares surged to over 21% of itineraries.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: MSE exceeded website fares in about 68% of searches, was not found in 15%, and was lower in 9% last week.
MSE emerged higher in 67% of cases, absent in 23%, with only 8% showing lower fares compared to the airline site.

gds_highlights.line_content: Over 98% of GDS itineraries are priced above the website, ticking up slightly from last month.
Less than 1% of fares remain cheaper in GDS, largely unchanged over recent weeks.
Website-only fares are consistently below 1% in GDS, down over 50% from the previous month in some segments.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Around 1% of fares are not mirrored in GDS, down 56% from last month’s levels.
Matching prices are virtually nonexistent, with no meaningful parity observed.
Nearly 99% of itineraries cost more on GDS, up about 0.5% from the prior month.
Under 0.1% of routes occasionally price lower on GDS, showing minimal week-to-week variation.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Around 98.9% of short-haul itineraries are higher on GDS, with just 1% of website-only fares.
Long haul shows an even stronger premium, at nearly 99.6% GDS-higher, and negligible GDS-lower cases.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: TR origin sees 99.3% GDS-higher fares, with under 1% website-only availability.
Non-TR origins also have predominantly GDS-higher fares at 98.3%, with a slight 0.24% showing lower GDS prices.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings remain about 98.9% GDS-higher, with 1% of fares missing in GDS.
Far-out itineraries see a slightly higher 99.2% GDS premium, with only 0.8% website-exclusive fares.
